title: New bus interchange for Pakenham
articleContent:
From 8 December, the new bus interchange at Pakenham Station will open, making it easier and safer to connect to trains and buses. Six metro and five regional bus routes will use the new bus interchange. 

As part of the Level Crossing Removal Project, the interchange will relocate from Station Street to Railway Avenue. 

Routes 840, 925, 926, 927, 928 and 929, as well as five regional bus routes, will have minor timetable, route and stop changes to access the new bus interchange. 

The five regional bus routes are Koo Wee Rup – Pakenham, Warragul – Pakenham, Pakenham – Garfield and Southern Cross – Traralgon Night Coaches. 

To plan your journey, download the PTV app, visit Journey planner or call 1800 800 007 to order a printed copy of your timetable. View the new maps and timetables for:

  • Route 840
    • Timetable (PDF) 195 KB
    • Map
  • Route 925
    • Timetable (PDF) 459 KB
    • Map
  • Route 926
    • Timetable (PDF) 739 KB
    • Map
  • Route 927
    • Timetable (PDF) 439 KB
    • Map
  • Route 928
    • Timetable (PDF) 480 KB
    • Map
  • Route 929
    • Timetable (PDF) 446 KB
    • Map

The Route 840 extension to Pakenham Place Shopping Centre will be removed, with the route now beginning and ending at Pakenham Station.  

There will be no change to operating hours or frequency.
